CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ann Jackson, part time city cleaner, 1707 Centre Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "Being that the next day is the Sabbath, people should have had enough enjoyment by 12 o'clock midnight, Saturday."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ann Jackson, wearing coat with fur collar, tweed skirt, and light colored blouse, carrying dark handbag, standing in front of Fanny Farmer Candies, Wood Street, Downtown
